dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.welcomeDesc: ðŸ˜Ž Don't know how to start? Click the button below to start a tutorial.

tutorial.step1: Dashboard is an overview of Chaos Mesh, where you can observe the running status of all experiments.
tutorial.step2: Experiments manages all experiments, where you can perform various operations (pause, archive, update, etc.) on the experiment.
tutorial.step3: Events shows the events generated by all experiments.
tutorial.step5: You can start your first experiment from here.
tutorial.step6: Search provides multiple syntaxes to help you locate experiments or events quickly. You can try it after creating an experiment.
tutorial.step7: Here you can browse the respective experiments, events and archives by selecting different namespaces.
tutorial.step8: Predefined can store custom experiments for quick execution in the future.
tutorial.step9: ðŸŽ‰ Congratulations on completing all the tutorial steps! Click the blank space to exit.

dashboard.veteranDesc: ðŸ§¨ Start with a new experiment! After it's successfully created, you can return the dashboard to observe its status.
dashboard.predefinedDesc: ðŸ“¦ Store custom experiments here for quick execution.

scope.affectedPodsPreviewHelper: Checking or unchecking Pods to further limit the scope of the experiment

target.podsPreviewHelper: Checking or unchecking Pods to further limit the scope of the target

schedule.tooltip: Chaos Mesh use {cronv3} to define the schedule. View its doc for more details.
schedule.mustBeScheduled: The chosen action must be scheduled
schedule.cronHelper: Use {crontabguru} to help generate the cron job and confirm what time it will run

experiments.title: Experiments

experiments.pauseDesc: You can restart the experiment in the same position
experiments.startDesc: The operation will take effect immediately

debugMode.choose: Creating an experiment will not send the real HTTP request, but will print relevant information in the console

enableKubeSystemNS.title: Kube System namespace
enableKubeSystemNS.choose: Allow to select the kube-system namespace in the scope when creating the experiment

addToken.prompt2: Don't know how to get the token?

addToken.title: Add Token
addToken.name: Name

common.name: Name
common.isKVHelperText: Type key:value and end with a space to generate a key/value pair

tip.title: Use the following syntax to quickly locate events, experiments and archives:
tip.namespace: namespace:default xxx will search for events, experiments and archives with namespace default
tip.kind: kind:NetworkChaos xxx will search for events, experiments and archives with kind NetworkChaos
tip.pod: pod:echoserver will search for events by affected Pod
tip.ip: ip:172.17.0.6 is will search for events by Pod IP
